website_summaries.verdict: Erythritol is a corn-based sugar alcohol that tastes almost as sweet as the real stuff, but without the glucose spike.
pros: 70% as sweet as sugar, minimal aftertaste
Does not spike blood glucose levels
cons: Some users report gastrointestinal distress after consuming

customer_reviews.title: We will never forget
customer_reviews.text: Two glasses of lemonade. One toilet. Two people racing to the bathroom. One of them had to crap in a bag because there was no other choice. Our butts were spraying, painful, turn the sink on full blast diarrhea. We will never be the same again.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Tomasi

customer_reviews.title: I hate artificial sweeteners
customer_reviews.text: I hate artificial sweeteners, they taste awful so when I started my keto diet I wanted something that had a good taste. The Stevia i bought at the supermarket was gross and had a bitter after taste, but this is great! It's natural and tastes and looks like sugar. Very happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Destiny989

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome! I've used it in waffles, muffins, cakes, frostings and whipped creams. I don't get an "aftertaste" at all. I'll even use it in my coffee, but my Mom says she gets a bad aftertaste when it isn't in baked goods. I prefer erythritol over any other sugar substitute and this brand/seller seems to really care about the product and their customers.
customer_reviews.author: ParisJade87

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Started using this sweetener about a month ago and I’m so glad I did! I didn’t realize the damage SUGAR was causing. Erythritol has prob been around for years but sadly I never considered a sugar substitute for anything in my kitchen. Once I started reading about KETO and the health benefits of NO sugar and Low carb, I learned about the MANY benefits of this sugar substitute. It tastes although it has a slight after taste but nothing you can’t get over or get used to. I’m happy I made the CHANGE. I’m also baking more than ever so my kids are loving it too!
customer_reviews.author: Katiejoel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sugar substitute
customer_reviews.text: Got this sweetener since I am doing the keto diet. I cannot stand the after taste of most sugar substitutes and this doesn’t have one! I like that it looks like real sugar and I cannot wait to use it in some baked goods! By the way, I have not had any stomach issues with this product as of right now.
customer_reviews.author: Stephatron

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoying this stuff. I recently started cutting out ...
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this stuff. I recently started cutting out sugar but really missed sweetening my coffee and teas so this really helped! I'm recommending this to my mom who has diabetes.
customer_reviews.author: Olga Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful sweetener, that doesn't have a weird aftertaste. I honestly could tell there was a difference when I added it to my coffee. I'll definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: B. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Caused diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I used about 8 tsp of this sweetener in 4 cups of coffee over two days. The first day I was pleased as the taste seemed to sufficiently emulate that of sugar. The second day found me in the bathroom several times with diarrhea and mild GI pain.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great sugar substitute
customer_reviews.text: I really like erythritol because it doesn't raise blood sugar like maltitol and xylitol. It doesn't have negative health effects like aspartame and sucralose. It is made from plants and tastes similar to sugar. Stevia is ok, but has a bad aftertaste. I'm glad this is an option out there. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Laird

customer_reviews.title: Great! I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This is great!! I really recomended!! I make my own Swerve blend, mix 6 cps of Erythitol 1 cp inulin 2 or maybe a little more of pure stevia powder. It can be well mix for a granulated version or blend it in a blender or processor to make it powder form. I love it and will order again this brand!! Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Casandra Torrales

customer_reviews.title: Taste great...
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far. Has no weird aftertaste or bitterness. Taste just like sugar to me, only less sweet. I do wonder about the safety of any artificial sweeteners, but that is just me being cautious. It seems like erythritol is safer than the others, but it is also used as an insecticide which makes me worry a bit. If you feel it is safe then this is a great non-GMO product.
customer_reviews.author: Bigvanvader

customer_reviews.title: So sad because I never leave bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Cooling sensation was OVERWHELMING and made my no bake oatmeal cookies unpalatable so I just threw them all away. So sad because I never leave bad reviews :(
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy May

customer_reviews.title: REALLY love this. Now I have had a real issue ...
customer_reviews.text: REALLY love this. Now I have had a real issue cutting sugar from my diet. I tried all the sugar substitutes on the market and have hated all of them for the aftertaste mostly. This is the closest thing to sugar I have ever tasted, however, if you want to get the same level that you maybe use to, it will take quite a bit. That's the thing, it is not very sweet so it takes a lot and I could see this being very expensive to use seeing how much it took to sweeten a cup of coffee to taste. So, either I'm cutting my sugar habit or now I have a new expensive bill. lol
customer_reviews.author: jade gold

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Discription
customer_reviews.text: The sellers claim that this product taste like sugar which is completely untrue. Although it looks like white sure except with finer granules if you use two teaspoons of sugar as I do normally you have to use at least for to get any sort of sweetness out of it. And it does NOT taste like sugar. What is worth I am now stuck with a product I paid for and cannot return which I will end up having to throw away as if I have money to throw away!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheba Shuber

customer_reviews.title: It is a wonderful product that does not impact your insuline hormone! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have baked a lot of goodies with this blessed item and besides of adding a delicious flavor into my sweet breads it has not added any pound into my weight, which it is an amazing feature of this sweetener! I trust this product 100 per cent! I love it! Thanks a million for bringing such joy into my new lifestyle.... low carb!
customer_reviews.author: Tzuriela Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I just went the tip of my finger and went in for a taste. Instant dizziness and then a headache followed. Thinking it couldn't be this erythritol I tried it in a cup of tea a few hours later. Instant dizziness and headache.
customer_reviews.author: william bullock

customer_reviews.title: I would just rather not eat recipes that call for sugar
customer_reviews.text: This sugar substitute is the worst. It leaves a tingling cooling sensation in my mouth hours after consumption. I would just rather not eat recipes that call for sugar
customer_reviews.author: Phillydiva

customer_reviews.title: Very unsweet.
customer_reviews.text: Almost flavorless and very unsweet. Had to use a ton of it to sweeten a cup of dark roast coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Vince C

customer_reviews.title: Medicine taste
customer_reviews.text: It has a strange, medicine taste. I threw an entire batch of cookies out. Have tried in coffee, but not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Marian Michelotti

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: The Erythritol Sweetener was a good purchase. The granules are fine but nut “dust thin”. We are on a Keto diet plan and many of the recipes call for Erythritol. I tried substituting Stevia and Splenda before using the Erythritol. This product seems to work better. It blends very well and does not oversweeten. The product has no lingering aftertaste which I appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Jean

customer_reviews.title: ... for a sugar substitute that does not leave that horrible after taste
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking for a sugar substitute that does not leave that horrible after taste. Read all the reviews on this product and they were excellent but had to see for myself. It REALLY does not leave an after taste like others do. We made butter cookies and it tastes just like sugar without all the calories/carbs! Conversion from sugar seems to be the same. Looking forward to trying another cookie recipe. Would highly recommend this product as a sugar substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This product has the look and feel of a fine sugar. It is not QUITE as sweet as sugar, but works just great in recipes calling for sugar and has way less carbs, the reason I bought it. I am very happy with the product so far, but am just starting to use it as part of a low carb Keto diet. The price obviously is much greater per gram than sugar, but not outrageous and is less than in my local grocery store. I will definitely be buying again and have no issues so far!
customer_reviews.author: M. Drake

customer_reviews.title: No after-taste.
customer_reviews.text: I recently started a ketogenic diet because I've discovered it's the only way I'm going to lose weight. I really missed my sugar but can't stand the after-taste of other sweeteners. Erythritol is the first one I've tried that did not leave me with a weird after-taste. It's a lot like sugar but I do have to use more of it to get the same sweetness. I also like that it's non-GMO.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Pami

customer_reviews.title: Better than Stevia! A true sugar substitute.
customer_reviews.text: I was a Stevia fan, but not after trying this! As good as Stevia is, it still has an aftertaste. It tastes like a really good alternative sweetener. This, on the other hand, tastes like sugar. No aftertaste at all! The look, feel, and weight of this granular version are just like standard white sugar. My mother and sister refuse to drink coffee without REAL sugar. I offered this to them in my usual sugar bowl. They both put it in their coffees this morning and couldn't tell the difference! I'm a convert!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: I really like the taste of this because it doesn't have that ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the taste of this because it doesn't have that nasty aftertaste that most sweeteners have. However, I noticed that it kind of makes my throat hurt. I have read that others have had a similar experience. Also, it doesn't dissolve as well as real sugar or monk fruit sweetener does. This is a great option for people on keto or that are diabetic. I do prefer monk fruit, but I still use this from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Nothing is all good or all bad...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so it doesn't taste exactly like sugar, but the taste isn't repulsive as some have claimed. It's slightly less sweet, a little odd until you get used to it, but it's sweeter than nothing at all. For me, it's just sweet enough to make my coffee more enjoyable. I'm getting used to it. On the down side, the gastrointestinal effects are real and they can be vicious. I find if I limit myself to two teaspoons a day (that's for the sweetener in one cup of coffee), the side effects are bearable. Not a perfect situation, but a trade-off I'm willing to make. As I said, nothing in life is all good or all bad.
customer_reviews.author: EJT, NYC

customer_reviews.title: just like sugar....but better!
customer_reviews.text: First I don't generally leave reviews but this product and its line warrant a serious thumbs up for multiple reasons. This is the 3rd product Ive tried of this seller. The others are the powders and both were wonderful for keto baking. This time i tried the granular, and bingo perfect sugar substitute. Highly recommend. Also, I had several product questions and they immediately responded - by far the best customer service. Vicky has been wonderful, and this will be the product line of choice. for sugar substitute in the future without doubt. Candidly Ive tried competitors but they are no where in the range of quality as this. Again just like sugar but much better!
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING good to say
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it non-refundable, but it smells strongly of chemicals and is more than just noticeably harsh on the throat. Erythritol is known to frequently cause serious GI upset as well as allergic reactions such as hives or more serious anaphylaxis. If somehow you can get over the smell, harshness, and common health risks seen with this product, you’ll also need to use more of this product for the same amount of sweetness as sugar, all while paying significantly more. Please don’t give these guys your money. You’re probably safer using aspartame or saccharin!
customer_reviews.author: William Reason

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cup of tea.
customer_reviews.text: I am trying Keto but I am struggling with removing sugar from my diet . I really hate sweeteners, never tried one that I liked, but decided to give this a try because of the high ratings. I was excited to get it but was stopped in my tracks by the smell. It has this strange strong chemical scent . I left it open for a few minutes to get rid of the smell but that did not help much . I used it to sweeten some tea and could not pass the first slip. I did not like it .. will not be using it .. sorry
customer_reviews.author: Hadiya Henry

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this but...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this sugar substitute, especially since I paid so much for it. I'm trying to find something less expensive than what is in the stores that tastes good. This did NOT fit the bill. It has a weird taste that I can't get around...metallic in a way...yuk! Then after a day of trying to get used to it I started to have loose stools...that was it. Not worth the money ....tasted awful and was making me sick. In the trash it went. Lesson learned...read reviews and listen.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Great stool softener!
customer_reviews.text: I think the headline says enough, requires 4 teaspoons full to equal 2 teaspoons of real sugar resulting in a great laxative.taste is ok. Will look for alternative sweetener.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: 0 calories - no guilt
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing stuff. My daughter suggested it. My specialty is homemade chocolate pies. It's tricky to make one that is sugar free without it either having an artificial taste or taste like glue. The Granular Erythritol Sweetener is PERFECT. I have to add a little extra can what is called for in the recipe, but the texture, taste and look is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon lover

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL TASTE
customer_reviews.text: I liked the consistency because it was almost like regular sugar. I wanted to use for sweetening coffee, cereal, oatmeal ECT. Really anything you use sugar for. I don't like my food real sweet, just slightly sweet. I was on the Keto diet and still wanted to use a sugar substitute that doesn't taste bitter and is safe. Had to use a few teaspoons for my coffee and stI'll no sweetness. Used in oatmeal and had to use more. The only thing I could taste was a weird cooling taste. Nothing like sugar. Wasn't bitter but taste was very unnatural. Was excited to try this one. Read reviews before I purchased and wasn't cheap for this small bag. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell/taste. Terrible!!
customer_reviews.text: So gross. Chemical smell when opening and baking didn’t get rid of that. I’m a pretty decent baker and this was so terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K.

customer_reviews.title: Taped up hole in package, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first time buying this product and I love it, however I was very disappointed with the package this time. When I took it out of the shipping material I noticed sugar everywhere. I soon realized that my bag had a hole on the side that was taped up. I am very disappointed that they would sell a product that was taped up. This product should have been thrown away. I had to throw away the sugar because I don’t know what made the hole and what if their was an animal/rodent in there. Not taking any chances. Unfortunately, I can’t request a return which sucks. So I just lost $10.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Tastes just like sugar!
customer_reviews.text: Tonight I’ve made Keto Lemon Bars and Keto dark chocolate cheese cake bars and I am beyond please with the way the sweetness turned out! I’ve been on Keto for 6 weeks now and I have been so tired of artifical sweetener flavor. This stuff really takes the cake (pun intended). Make sure to follow the recipes on how to prevent crystallization and you’ll be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Ashely Loren Gunn

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have tried it before I bought 3 bags!
customer_reviews.text: When I started keto 6 months ago, I purchased this to replace my sugar. I t looks just like regular cane sugar and comes in powdered as well. Score right? Wrong! It has an overwhelming cooling sensation, almost like a menthol taste that I could not get over. It sat in my pantry because it was too expensive to toss. I recently tried it again and I just can’t get over the taste. I’ve baked with it, used in coffee, but it’s still the same. I wish I would have tried it before I bought 3 bags. I do not like erythritol.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Hole in bag
customer_reviews.text: There was a hole in the bottom of the bag when I recieved it! Lost alot of sugar. This item can't be returned or exchanged.
customer_reviews.author: Keigan Monceaux

customer_reviews.title: Chemical taste
customer_reviews.text: I made zucchini bread, gluten free and used erythritol. I am trying to not use sugar and I use xylitol often, but not in baked goods. It seems that both erythritol and xylitol aren't suitable for baked goods, at least for me. The erythritol, I found plenty sweet enough but there was a chemical aftertaste in the bread. I will keep trying to find the right substitute.
customer_reviews.author: PWM

customer_reviews.title: No bad aftertaste!
customer_reviews.text: I dont like any kind of sugar substitute! This however is a natural sweetener and doesn't have a aftertaste! I've used it to make iced and hot tea, coffee drinks and baking and so far everything tastes great! And that's the whole point if you're trying to do a low carb or just need to cut back on sugar ! My husband is now using this to replace his sugar in his coffee! And he didn't notice it in some of my baking, so this is a win win! He is pre diabetic so I had to find a substitute for sugar that he likes and am myself trying to lower my sugar intake.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie A.

customer_reviews.title: No harsh taste, just sweetness ❤️
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed my first bag of this sugar, I just started a second one, it really is like sugar, but without the calories and the chemical stuff..some of the other fake stuff leaves you with a bad taste in your mouth, it’s teally gross. It does gets very sweet when you add two tea spoon into the coffee, so therefore I only need one and a half teaspoon, less is more with this sugar! I think I stick around with this one, it doesn’t have a harsh after taste, it’s kind of nice :)
customer_reviews.author: GoldieElle

customer_reviews.title: Very good Product
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this product in place of cane sugar and so far I am very happy with it. I also made a couple of the low-carb desert recipes in the book provided and they are very good and works with the keto diet plan. For example - I made the avocado mousse and you could not tell it was made with avocado - which for me is not an issue, but some people don't like these great fruits. So don't tell them what is in there - just serve them a yummy desert! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MMusic, Sarasota FL

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative but aftertaste burned...
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative to sugar but I found it burned my throat. I made Keto brownies with it and the aftertaste left a burning sensation in my throat. In coffee, it was not noticeable but you do have to use quite a lot to get any sweet flavor. Also, this bag lasted me about 3 baking recipes so keep that in mind! It's not as sweet as sugar so you have to use way more of it. Overall, not a fan, but it is Keto approved... :/
customer_reviews.author: Madi W.

customer_reviews.title: Taste OK
customer_reviews.text: Well, 3 Stars because im still not used to the taste honestly. But it tastes a lot better then Truvia. Hopefully ill get used to the taste soon. Im used to regular sugar, but this is 100% healthier
customer_reviews.author: Bruna

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Tastes like sugar to me!
customer_reviews.text: I like the taste-it doesn't taste different from regular sugar. It's easy to use in place of real sugar (1 1/3 cup = 1 cup sugar). As always, anything that is different costs more; always, always looking for better price, but will pay this if it helps me to lose weight & keep it off. Thank you for the dessert recipes. I did try the chocolate mousse; it was plenty sweet and chocolatey, but I just didn't care for the avocado part. BUT, I did try it & that is part of making healthier choices. I will be trying some of the other recipes, so again thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Baker

customer_reviews.title: Stellar customer service
customer_reviews.text: Received an open package which was completely spilled by the time I received. Attempted to return to amazon but not eligible for return or refund yet is advertised as 100% guaranteed. FALSE ADVERTISING. Waste of money UPDATE 9/24/2019 This product customer service is stellar. 5 stars for sure. After contacting them with my concerns, they immediately sent a replacement which I received next day. The product is clean and sweet with absolutely no after taste. Slightly less sweet than sugar, as advertised. Will most like repurchase. Deducting half a star for inability to return/exchange directly via amazon website.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent substitute for sugar in baked goods
customer_reviews.text: I’m not diabetic, but I limit my intake of carbs and sugar. I never buy bread anymore, but occasionally I crave banana bread, coffee cake, etc., so when I found a recipe for Keto banana bread that called for granulated erythritol and almond flour, I was keen to try it. I’m very pleased with the taste. The erythritol works great as a sugar substitute. It’s a little expensive, but worth it for an occasional sweet treat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scheppler

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sweetener! I found it as an alternative to sugar when I started my keto diet and was having issues because I had a sweet tooth. I can finally make my deserts without worrying about my blood sugar and calories and my baking still comes out amazing. You got a customer for life ♥️
customer_reviews.author: Ade

customer_reviews.title: Not loving it yet...
customer_reviews.text: Tried making keto flan. Recipe called for erythitol, not sugar and that's exactly what I used. Caramelized top was hard and colorless. Custard was not tasty and had a funny texture. Tried it on sliced strawberries as well. Didn't care much for that either. Next, I'm going to try baking with it. I'll get back with you all and let you know how that goes. Here's hoping something works. I have 2.5 lbs. to use up!
customer_reviews.author: Goldylox2U

customer_reviews.title: The I can't believe is not sugar
customer_reviews.text: It tastes and feels like actual refined sugar. No bitter or strange aftertaste like Stevia or other sweetners. This like any other substitute needs to be used in moderation. The reason why I say this, is because this is as sweet as sugar (as oppose to Stevia which is increadibly sweet) so don't buy this thinking you will be able to use a ton of it without consequence. I actualy bought this to mix with a Strevia I have purchased previously, this way I use very little product and don't get bitterness from Stevia.
customer_reviews.author: ykza5

customer_reviews.title: Sweet substitute for sugar
customer_reviews.text: Just started doing lazy Keto and still want to satisfy my sweet tooth. Decided to try erythritol. While it doesn't exactly taste like sugar, it has a sweet taste and you have to use more of it to equal out to the same amount of sugar. It has a slight cooling taste to it. I made keto brownies with it and they turned out pretty good. Just have to remember not to eat a lot because you'll need make a dash for the bathroom... Overall, I'd buy again and maybe next time get the powdered one.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great- NO aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product but I drink a lot of tea and like it sweetened. This product is great, honestly I don't know why this is not widely advertised as a sugar alternative. It is great. I recommend it for anyone looking for that holy grail of zero calorie sweetener-one that actually tastes like sugar and has no after taste. I think I saw in some other reviews that it does not melt well in hot drinks. That sure has not been my experience! It immediately dissolves in hot tea. I am using the granulated form. I will be ordering more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: there is an after taste
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this does help bulk up product when baking cookies, cake, etc. However, in a frosting I feel like the brackish after taste was over whelming and I scraped it off all of my cupcakes. I ground the sugar so it would very fine like a powdered sugar thinking it would help, but alas, no go. I prefer using a ganache to avoid a powdered sugar frosting now, however on a pumpkin cupcake chocolate doesn't appeal!
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Fan Tudie

customer_reviews.title: Keto friendly
customer_reviews.text: Love to use it for cooking it give my cheesecake a wonderful taste. It’s the best sugar to use when your doing the Keto diet and my daughter loves to use it in her iced tea.
customer_reviews.author: carol treadway

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using erythritol, I choose this product for its size, natural ingredents and vaule. It arrived on time as described. No moisture in bag it is like sugar a bit finer. It has a tiny taste to it not unpleasant but not quite like sugar either. I just wanted to cut out more sugar from my diet and I like a teaspoon in my coffee, this works fine. I haven't tried other products so I cannot compare but I can say this is a good one and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Oreo

customer_reviews.title: No after-taste
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes enjoy a little sweetness in my coffee or other beverages, and erythritol is perfect. It doesn't have an after-taste like some artificial sweeteners. I am health conscious and don't like ingesting chemicals and this is the only sweetener approved by my Naturopath. The bag is resealable so it is easy to store in the pantry or have some handy in a sugar bowl. I just need to be be careful with limited use since it is a sugar alcohol and can cause digestive problems at high doses. But this tastes even better than stevia.
customer_reviews.author: Joywriter

customer_reviews.title: Very good sugar substitute
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sugar substitute I’ve had. It has no lingering, chemical after taste like every other one I’ve tried. I bought the granulated and it’s like super fine sugar. My only negative comment is that you have to use a lot more than regular sugar. However I prefer that to being overly sweet. I read that Swerve brand has a minty after taste as do some others but this one does not. I’m very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle DaSilva

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting erythritol!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product! I will buy it again and again AND I have recommended it to friends! I bought the larger bag for the better value and I am glad I did. I use this in a keto pound cake recipe that even non-keto, sugar lovers love! Tastes better than other brands I have tried. I also am happy to support a small company that is very conscious of their consumers. I was sent a free recipe book from So Nourished to download and I recommend the lemon bars recipe! It too, was a big hit with "regular" sugar lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Gracious

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I am following the KETO diet and I was looking for a substitute for the sweetness for my coffee, since I have been using sweeteners for a long time, I was looking for something more natural. Then I found this erythritol that attracted me, but the taste in coffee is terrible, nothing even compared to the sweetener (not even close for real) the appearance, it looks like real sugar So what I wanted didn’t work, I didn’t do anything with it other than that, so for bake... it might be good.
customer_reviews.author: Karine Pontes da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Beware of possible severe diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the legal disclaimer on their page but thought 'that won't happen to me'. I also saw where other people had the same problem but I still bought the product. I spent all day and half the night 'running' to the bathroom with diarrhea. it was a terrible experience for a 78 year old woman trying to watch the NFL Championship games. Too bad because the product really tastes good. While I'm complaining I'll also say the price is very high in comparison to equal amounts of sugar, Sweet 'n Low, etc. Good Luck.
customer_reviews.author: awfulart

customer_reviews.title: How so many stars ?!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so distraught by this product. How did it get such reviews?! I was excited to have it arrive and added it to my coffee yesterday morning. OMG! It tasted like vodka had been poured in with my creamer. I was expecting a cooking sensation id heard about but not this. It was “chemically”. Maybe I just had a bad batch, I don’t know but Yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy J. Kershner

customer_reviews.title: Very Expensive but Will Purchase Again
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the price of the Erythritol. Okay now that I have that out of the way I have to say that yes, I would buy again. This looks and tastes like sugar. You do have to use more, it is not equivalent in measurements. ( 1 cup of sugar = 1 1/3 cups Erythritol) So far I have used to make sweet tea and whipped cream. Both turned out great. It is stored in a ziploc bag which keeps it fresh. I had no issues with seller, It was delivered on time and packing intact.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have no recourse than to leave a negative review...
customer_reviews.text: ...Since amazon will not allow me to return this item. I ordered a $15 bag of Erythritol, and what I got was an half empty bag and a box full loose Erythritol. With a pandemic going on - there's no way we can salvage any of this. It appears to be a manufacturers defect with the bag as the all the seams on one side are busted open. Terribly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Joel from Chesterfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative!
customer_reviews.text: I received the product over the weekend and started experimenting right away with baked goods and found that you have to find your own "balance" for your taste. I followed a couple of recipies to the T, as it was my first time using it. One came out with a hint of sweetness and the other the level of sweetness was a little over powering. Since Erythritol is recommended as a great alternative to regular sugar, I will continue to experiment. Thanks for the option!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the Keto diet and they recommended this product. It's definitely not as sweet as sugar but just add more. I really like that there is no aftertaste like so many sweeteners. Great in cooking. Also, I would always get severe abdominal pains with other sweeteners but this does not bother me at all. Happy to find this.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L.

customer_reviews.title: Good sweetener for keto diet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in keto recipes. It takes a little adjustment and experimentation to get the right amount for recipes because to me, it isn't as sweet as regular sugar so it takes a bit more. There is also a cooling aftertaste that I had to get used to but otherwise it is natural and a very good alternative to sugar in recipes. I plan to keep it on hand for this way of eating.
customer_reviews.author: Watcher0fW0rlds

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I thought this had a weird taste to it. I made banana bread with it and it just tasted weird. I could taste it very plainly. I also made some fudgsicles with it. It wasn't AS bad in those, but still not the best. Also, this gave me headaches after eating what I made with it. May be all right for some people, but I threw the rest away.
customer_reviews.author: Nature girl

customer_reviews.title: Actually tastes GOOD, with no after taste!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried stevia, monk fruit, various combinations of these with erythritol, and now this plain erythritol. THIS IS THE BEST!! The others have obnoxious after-tastes which I cannot stand. Erythritol by itself has no after-taste and tastes just like sugar. So glad I found this! Came in a nice secure package.
customer_reviews.author: ladymusic39

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Just made a delicious low carb dessert! The erythritol was totally fine. Great ebook. Really quality stuff from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: R.G.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SUBSTITUTE FOR SUGAR
customer_reviews.text: This looks just like sugar and great substitute for real sugar I did not taste any after taste....so this works well only used it when I made some plant based chilli....
customer_reviews.author: lagirl

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for sugar
customer_reviews.text: Never tried to use erythritol before buying this stuff but we were very satisfied. It blends great, and doesn't leave a funky artificial sweetener aftertaste. It doesn't completely replace sugar 1:1 but I may've used 20 percent over what recipes required and this did great. This isn't for everyone though, some of my family had indigestion because your body doesn't actually digest sugar alcohols.
customer_reviews.author: Seth W

customer_reviews.title: Very good sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sweetener. I was impressed because a previous brand erythrotol did not really dissolve well, even in hot water. The previous brand also was a brownish gray when it was dissolved in water, it also left a lot of residue in my coffee cup as well as a gritty sludge when getting to the bottom of a cup of coffee. Now for this brand... dissolved very well in hot water, tastes great, and doesn’t leave a residue in my cup.
customer_reviews.author: T-Meister

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor
customer_reviews.text: The product is the first non sugar based sweetener I enjoy. It doesn’t have a terrible after taste and is almost as great as sugar. The packaging is fine - however it did spill from an unknown hole - so I can’t give it 5 stars. Likewise obviously it’s not that cheap so the cost is 4 stars in my opinion. At any rate - I will be purchasing more for my Leto friendly desserts!
customer_reviews.author: kati

customer_reviews.title: This did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the chemical test and cold aftertaste. I really wanted to like the product because it baked well. However, the taste was just too odd for me. The product description says there is a 100% money back guarantee but I am unsure how to return the product. Amazon says it is not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Engels

customer_reviews.title: No No No
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry but I know this is suppose to be a natural product but I can't get past the taste. I made brownies with it and they were bitter! I have better luck with stevia. I tasted it on it's own and it was not sweet to me. I probably won't purchase it again. It's an expensive waste for me to try baking with.
customer_reviews.author: designs by eliana

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: My package arrived on time and in good condition. Nice looking packaging. Recloses easily. My wife and I are trying the Keto Diet and Erythritol is included in several recipes. I used it in a recipe for Korean spicy wings. They were delicious, but the sugar substitute was not noticeable. I'll try it in a few different recipes and update the review as warranted.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Allen

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Aftertaste is minimal
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Aftertaste is minimal. It mixes well into hot beverages but needs a little extra stirring into cold beverages. The only major con is the seal on the bag.. It fell off my pantry shelf and the top busted wide open. Unfortunately I lost a good bit of it. Lesson learned, I'll store it differently going forward
customer_reviews.author: LEMoore

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I consulted with my Integrative Health Specialist. We discussed any possible issues (which are rare anyway) with my using this product and decided that it was fine for me to use as a substitute for sugar in coffee, cooking, etc. So far it's been a good alternative and I would recommend it, but always consult your health professional, of course, to make sure it's right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Sweet as punch
customer_reviews.text: Boy was I surprised at this sweetner! I have tried so many artificial sweetners but this was wonderful - and natural! Plus, it handles just like sugar. I measured it with ease and there is no bitter after affect. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Terrier1970

customer_reviews.title: The aftertaste is like alcohol.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I ordered the wrong product. I intended to purchase xylitol. What I got was erythritol, and it has a strong aftertaste of alcohol. I don't drink, and I am extremely sensitive to its taste. However, it was totally my fault for ordering the wrong sweetener...at least now I know I do not like erythritol.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia  Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cookies
customer_reviews.text: Used this product to make some keto-ish, low carb chocolate chip cookies, found recipe online. Everyone that has tried the cookies, just loves them. This product works well as the sugar substitute. Slight flavor from it, but nothing too extreme. The dark chocolate chips helps the sweetness level.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gargano

customer_reviews.title: My new Go 2 “sugar”
customer_reviews.text: I started on the Keto diet so I could lose 10# belly fat and bought the Keto in 5 recipe book. I have a sweet tooth so the dessert recipes looked good and the sweetener was erythritol. Actually ALL the recipes are good! In 4 weeks I’ve lost 7 pounds! Energy is up, cravings gone, weight going down. This is a diet I can maintain! I’m very happy with this product and the Keto concept in general!
customer_reviews.author: Kimba

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I love this product! I've had digestive problems with other erythritol products but not with So-Nourish. It's sweet without being cloying with no after taste like some other sweetners. I especially like it in my keto fat bombs, chocolate peanut butter and oatmeal cookie, my favorites). I like the texture and the ease of using it in my recipes. I've already bought my second bag and look forward to using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for people like myself who are on KETO. We’ve made some delicious KETO desserts with this product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great product....poor packaging for shipment
customer_reviews.text: Not my first purchase of this product. It is a very good product. My latest shipment arrived with a hole in the bag, and the sweetener leaked out all through my Amazon shipping box and a lot of my product was unusable. I don’t fault the manufacturer but I don’t think Amazon packed the box very well. It was just thrown in the box with 2 air pillows on top. Really not enough to keep it from bounding around during shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Rett

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Came damaged two puncture holes in the bag, had leaked all inside the box, and was leaking out the box as well. Plus it was 2 days late arriving. But am reordering. Product came today and everything was great. I replace the damaged goods and gave me a credit for them as well. Great taste very satisfied!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellen Heimlich

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this as low carb sweetener. I do all kinds of cooking, baking and mixing with this. For me this has been the best sweetener so far. I've tried other low carb sweeteners and this by far tastes the best. Some people complain about "cool" experience. I noticed first time I tried it and haven't noticed since. Also, use this to make whipped cream!! YUM!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sweet as I'd like, but its not stevia!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Erythritol because I was following the keto diet and could not stand the aftertaste of stevia. It was unbearable! This does not have any aftertaste. It is not as sweet as sugar, not by a long shot. I tried using the recommended amount in a brownie recipe and it was awful. Way too bitter. If you need a little bit of sweetener for coffee or tea, this is definitely a better alternative than stevia. However, it is not great for baking.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiN

customer_reviews.title: A VERY good substitute for sugar
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't taste precisely like sugar. There is a slight cooling effect on the tongue. However, in coffee you cannot tell the difference except that you use more of this than sugar. I would say 20% more to get the same perceived sweetness. But for no unnatural chemicals, no net carbs and no calories I do not think you can beat it. Kind of surprised they don't sell it in packets like Sweet N Low etc.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great taste and value
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all low carb and no carb sweeteners and this is by far the best. Not only does it have a great flavor with no bad aftertaste, it doesn't hurt my stomach and does not knock me out of ketosis as does Splenda. This sweetener was recommended to me by a doctor that studies the effects of foods on our bodies and this was one of the top two sweeteners.
customer_reviews.author: bswand

customer_reviews.title: Gives cooling sentation and runs if over eaten.
customer_reviews.text: Love this sweetener, but watch out if over eaten can have runs as when I mean over eating is 2 cookies. Hoping my stomach will get used to this sweetener. No aftertaste whats so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Anutkini Glazki

customer_reviews.title: Good for Keto, lowcarb, diabetic etc
customer_reviews.text: This is a great find. If your diabetic, doing a low carb diet or simply trying to eliminate sugar from your diet this is a great product. I use it mixed with some monk fruit when I bake or on its own. It is basically same texture as table sugar and sweetness very much the same. It does have a kind of coolng feeling in the mouth but nothing too bad. I taste no bad aftertaste which is great.
customer_reviews.author: cin3dee

customer_reviews.title: Loved! Great for people with glycemic issues or wanting to watch your figure!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and this company! I'm not a diabetic but I do have blood sugar problems. This product doesn't spike my blood sugar. I put it in my coffee in the morning and I never feel the "fall" or "crash" like I do with regular sugar. It's beautifully packaged and from a small company. I love being able to support small businesses. I suggest this product to everyone I know!
customer_reviews.author: Robbi Selby

customer_reviews.title: Great for making desserts
customer_reviews.text: I love this product!! Leaves no aftertaste in my desserts. In my coffee it does not sweeten as much as I would like adding 2 teaspoons to a full 14 oz cup the way the Splenda blend does. But using that is out of the question now, so I just have to get used to drinking my coffee less sweet or adding a packet of equal or sweet and low to it. I know these artificial sweetners are Not good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Great for KETO diets
customer_reviews.text: Used it as one-to-one sub for sugar and it's great; I'll probably cut back a little next time as it is very sweet. No aftertaste, no insulin spike. Pricey compared to sugar but not addictive like sugar and since I'm cutting way back on sugar and refined products in general, and eating KETO, it's a great substitute when I need a sweetener. I bought the confectioners version back in the fall and it's a great substitute, too.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sugar Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Decent sugar alternative but definitely not the same as the real thing. That it is definitely not a real "sugar" and a substitute but is suitable to the task for baking, cooking, etc. There's no aftertaste as you would find with other alternative sweeteners and that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Love the taste...and NO after-taste
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this product to use for baking, and have found this brand to be the absolute best tasting by far :-D!! My whole family enjoys the taste as it leaves no artificial after-taste as some sweetners do. I will most definitely be buying this particular brand again and again...finally a product worth every cent- one tasty baked-good bite at a time ;-)! Thanks for a great product and excellent service, to boot!! Sincerely, sc
customer_reviews.author: s c

customer_reviews.title: Tasteless
customer_reviews.text: I expected this product to be less sweet than sugar but without any bitter taste. I have much too much sugar in my diet and this seemed a good way to cut down while avoiding chemicals in artificial sweeteners. It's not bitter but basically is without taste. My wife has a much more discerning palate than I do and she agrees. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great taste!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flavor. To me it taste pretty much identical to regular sugar. Worked well in my recipe when using for first time. Only negative is that I'm noticing today an excessive amount of abdominal gas and some discomforts in my digestive system. Maybe it does not agree with me? Little on the pricey side for the amount you get.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sugar substitute
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Perfect sugar substitute. Dissolves easily is hot liquids. Haven’t tried cold liquids but sugar doesn’t always dissolve well in cons liquids. Works just like sugar for baking. Comes in a resealable pouch. Perfect! Update 12/26/18. I ran out and bought an erythritol product at my grocery store. Horrible bitter taste! Had to throw it out. I will only buy from So Nourish from now on.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clinton

product_meta.title: Erythritol Sweetener Granular - 1:1 Sugar Substitute, Keto - 0 Calorie, 0 Net Carb, Non-GMO (1 lb / 16 oz)
feature_bullets: ZERO CALORIE & ZERO CARB - Natural sweetener that tastes and bakes like sugar
NO BITTER AFTERTASTE - This erythritol is not only healthier than sugar, it also has almost no aftertaste. In a blind taste test you might mistake it for sugar.

100% MONEY BACK GUARANTEE! We stand behind our granulated erythritol 100%. If for any reason you decide our erythritol isn't for you, email us & we’ll refund you 100% of your money, no questions asked.
ZERO GLYCEMIC IMPACT - Suitable for Diabetics & Low Carb Dieters
